intro: Oxyosmyles viscosissima, commonly known as the sticky oxyosmyles, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which contribute to its sticky texture. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists studying xerophytic adaptations.
